intro: Balbisia peduncularis, commonly known as the red-eyed cycad, is a unique plant belonging to the Cycadaceae family. It is characterized by its stout, unbranched trunk and large, compound leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces cone-like structures, with the female cones bearing red, fleshy seeds that are enclosed in a spathaceous sheath. Native to the tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, warm climates with well-drained soil. Due to its slow growth and specific care requirements, it is a popular specimen plant in botanical gardens and private collections.
